title: Strokes2Surface: Recovering Curve Networks From 4D Architectural Design Sketches. (arXiv:2306.07220v2 [cs.GR] UPDATED)
abstract: We present Strokes2Surface, an offline geometry-reconstruction pipeline built upon a 4D Sketching Interface, MR.Sketch, targeted at architectural design. The pipeline recovers a curve network from designer-drawn strokes, thus bridging between concept design and digital modeling stages in architectural design. The input to our pipeline consists of 3D strokes' polyline vertices and their corresponding timestamps (as of the fourth dimension), along with additional geometric and stylus-related recorded properties. Inspired by sketch consolidation and sketch-based modeling methods, our pipeline leverages such data and combines three Machine Learning (ML) models; a classifier and two clustering models. translated_title: Strokes2Surface：从四维建筑设计素描中恢复曲线网络
translated_abstract: 本文介绍了一个离线几何重建管道Strokes2Surface，它是基于4D Sketching Interface，MR.Sketch的目标是面向建筑设计的。该管道从设计师绘制的笔画中恢复曲线网络，因此在建筑设计的概念设计和数字建模阶段之间建立了桥梁。我们的管道的输入包括3D笔画的折线顶点及其相应的时间戳（作为第四个维度），以及额外的几何和笔触相关的记录属性。基于素描合并和基于素描建模方法的启发，我们的管道利用这些数据并组合三个机器学习（ML）模型；一个分类器和两个聚类模型。特别是，根据建筑设计素描中设计师通常采用的实践观察，我们解决了一个二元分类问题，以识别一笔画是描绘边界和边缘还是用于填充所需建筑物的封闭区域和表面。
tldr: 本文介绍了Strokes2Surface，它可从建筑师的笔画中恢复出曲线网络，对于建筑设计中的概念设计和数字建模之间的桥梁具有重要意义。
en_tdlr: Strokes2Surface is presented in this paper as an offline geometry-reconstruction pipeline for architectural design, recovering curve network from designer-drawn strokes, thus bridging the gap between concept design and digital modeling.
